title: Muumiraamatute lugemismaraton
content:
Soomes algab 30. jaanuaril Tove Janssoni (1914–2001) esimese muumiraamatu 80. sünnipäeva puhul tõeline muumimaraton: üle saja tuntud inimese loevad Yle Areena kanali otse-eetris ette kõik üheksa pikka muumiraamatut.

Mullu osutus Väinö Linna „Tundmatu sõduri“ 70. sünnipäeva puhul korraldatud lugemismaraton väga menukaks, Yle Areena voogedastusplatvormil üle miljoni vaatamisega. Toona oli lugejaid 67, tänavu 30. jaanuarist 1. veebruarini kestval muumimaratonil on lugejaid umbes poole rohkem ja kõik muumiraamatud loetakse ette Yle Areena voogedastusplatvormi otse-eetris.

Muumi-lugusid loevad nädalavahetuse kestval maratonil teiste seas endine peaminister Sanna Marin, näitleja-muusik Johannes Brotherus, näitleja Leena Uotila, kirjanik Iida Turpeinen, endine Finlandia kandidaat
creator: Peep Ehasalu

title: The Naked Truth – Discussion Festival in Saunas
content:
Discussion Festival in Saunas by the Emajõgi River in May – The Naked Truth.

It is a discussion festival in saunas, is returning to Tartu! This event combines a sauna festival and a discussion festival, where the sauna benches serve as discussion stages. The goal is to create a pleasant gathering, promote sauna culture, and develop a conversation culture inspired by the sauna experience.
creator: Peep Ehasalu

title: Romaan surmast ja piire trotsivast armastusest
content:
Ühinenud Ajakirjade Vesta raamatukirjastusel ilmus värskelt trükist soome kirjaniku Anna Englundi romaan „Puust palitu“ („Lautapalttoo“). Raamatu tõlkis eesti keelde Triin Tael.

On aasta 1931. Elena kannab Soome maakülas edasi kirstude valmistamise traditsiooni: ta abikaasa hoolitseb puutöö eest, tema enese ülesandeks on polsterdused ning eakas ämm teeb, mis jaksab. Surm on selles peres igapäevane kolleeg ja elu kulgeb tavapärast rada.

Ent pealinnast kirstu tellima tulnud isevärki naine pöörab kõik pea peale. Armastus on jõud, mis inimest muudab, kuid kas armastuse poole püüeldes tohib elu alussambaid lammutada?

„Anna Englund joonistab
creator: Peep Ehasalu

title: The President of ISA Risto Elomaa welcomes Tartu 24
content:
Sauna and sauna bathing has been in several cultural capitals during the years one of the important subjects. And this is continuing also in the future here in Tartu as well as in the coming capitals like Chemnitz in Germany, Oulu in Finland etc. It is interesting to see how this can also organise cooperation between the different capitals in different countries.

Next year the capital is Tartu and it is more than natural that sauna is a part of the programs. The smoke sauna culture in Estonia was taken to the UNESCO´s list in 2014 and this has been making the sauna culture stronger in Estonia. This year 2023 has been a special SAUNAYEAR. E.g. during this weekend there is a big sauna event in Rõuge here in Southern Estonia.

NAKED TRUTH festival of saunas as
creator: Peep Ehasalu

title: ReadHour in Estonia 2023
content:
Finnish Institute has organized RH in Estonia since 2021. This year we organise it in cooperation with Tartu Public Library, Tallinn Central Library and Estonian Children’s Literature Centre.

Last year ReadHour won great popularity also in social media (Office of the President among others did post picture of their staff reading). Our aim is that in couple of years ReadHour will be celebrated spontaneously in libraries, schools and workplaces, even without a need it to be organised.

This year the biggest events will take place in Tartu and Tallinn. At 11 AM libraries will bring books to public places and people are offered to make their choice they want to read. Everyone is invited to join also with their own books. During this hour people will have a chance to listen also
creator: Peep Ehasalu

title: V INTERNATIONAL UUNO KLAMI COMPOSITION COMPETITION GETS UNDER WAY
content:
The International Uuno Klami Composition Competition, one of the world’s foremost
composition competitions, is being held for the fifth time in 2023–2024. The Jury will be
Finland’s Kalevi Aho, Magnus Lindberg and Lotta Wennäkoski, and Sweden’s Mats
Larsson Gothe, four of the greatest composers and most influential musical figures of
their generation. Conductor Anna-Maria Helsing will also join the jury at a later stage,
she will conduct the competition’s final concerts in autumn 2024. Aho and Lindberg have
been part of the jury since the foundation of the composition competition, since 2003,
Larsson Gothe and Wennäkoski are new members of the jury.

The competition is open to citizens of any EU Member State, of a Nordic country, or of
Alban
creator: Peep Ehasalu

title: Open Call for Art Projects: Together Alone
content:
The current crisis is severely affecting the cultural sector. Many artists and creatives  whose work is project-based have lost months worth of income. 

Amongst the crisis, the mission of the Finnish Cultural and Academic Institutes remains unchanged. We exist to promote international mobility, visibility and collaboration of Finnish art, culture and science. That is why we are launching a new and fast progressing open call for Finnish and Finland-based artists and artist groups. 

TOGETHER ALONE – OPEN CALL

The Institutes are seeking artistic proposals related to the following themes: state of emergency, radical change, resilience, artistic practice in the future, alone together. At the same time the project will act as a documentation of the crisis
creator: Soome Instituut

title: OPEN CALL: (Re)configuring Territories residency
content:
OPEN CALL: (Re)configuring Territories welcomes applications for a six-week Residency in May–June 2020.
The Residency is meant for practitioners and researchers who share an interest in situated practices and speculative approaches.
The chosen resident will live and work at Narva Art Residency where they can concentrate on their research and/or artistic practice.

Submit your application via email by March 15, 2020, 23:59 CET.
applications@reconfiguringterritories.net

More info at: https://reconfiguringterritories.net
P. S. There is also a (Re) configuring Territories Spring School coming! Participation is available to the 15 selected. The application period will
creator: Soome Instituut

title: Inspiration Lunch in Tallinn
content:
EST

The Finnish Institute in Estonia, Creative Estonia, Nordic Council of Ministers’ Office in Estonia and Tartu Centre of Creative Industries organize a Lunch and Discussion Series at Kino Artis in Tallinn during spring 2014.

 

The purpose of the series is to share best practices in creative economy development, comparing views and experiences as well as getting to know different ways of practice. This will help to build up a network and to promote developing soft landing services for creative entrepreneurs to the international market.
Discussions will start at 11.30 with lunch which will be followed by discussion at 12.00 till
creator: Soome Instituut
